properties.name: database_name
properties.description: (Required) The user’s authentication database. A user must provide both a username and authentication database to log into MongoDB. In Atlas deployments of MongoDB, the authentication database is always the admin database.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The unique ID for the project to create the database user.

properties.name: roles
properties.description: (Required) List of user’s roles and the databases / collections on which the roles apply. A role allows the user to perform particular actions on the specified database. A role on the admin database can include privileges that apply to the other databases as well. See Roles below for more details.

properties.name: username
properties.description: (Required) Username for authenticating to MongoDB.

properties.name: password
properties.description: (Optional) User's initial password. This is required to create the user but may be removed after. Password may show up in logs, and it will be stored in the state file as plain-text. Password can be changed in the web interface to increase security.

properties.name: roles-1
properties.description: » Roles

Block mapping a user's role to a database / collection. A role allows the user to perform particular actions on the specified database. A role on the admin database can include privileges that apply to the other databases as well.
NOTE: The available privilege actions for custom MongoDB roles support a subset of MongoDB commands. See Unsupported Commands in M10+ Clusters for more information.
IMPORTANT: If a user is assigned a custom MongoDB role, they cannot be assigned any other roles.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the role to grant. See Create a Database User roles.roleName for valid values and restrictions.

properties.name: database_name
properties.description: (Required) Database on which the user has the specified role. A role on the admin database can include privileges that apply to the other databases.

properties.name: collection_name
properties.description: (Optional) Collection for which the role applies. You can specify a collection for the read and readWrite roles. If you do not specify a collection for read and readWrite, the role applies to all collections in the database (excluding some collections in the system. database).

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the project in which to add the whitelist entry.

properties.name: cidr_block
properties.description: (Optional) The whitelist entry in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation. Mutually exclusive with ip_address.

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: (Optional) The whitelisted IP address. Mutually exclusive with cidr_block.

properties.name: comment
properties.description: (Optional) Comment to add to the whitelist entry.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The unique ID for the project to create the database user.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: provider_name - (Required) Cloud service provider on which the servers are provisioned.

properties.name: AWS
properties.description: Amazon AWS

properties.name: GCP
properties.description: Google Cloud Platform

properties.name: AZURE
properties.description: Microsoft Azure

properties.name: TENANT
properties.description: A multi-tenant deployment on one of the supported cloud service providers. Only valid when providerSettings.instanceSizeName is either M2 or M5.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the cluster as it appears in Atlas. Once the cluster is created, its name cannot be changed.

properties.name: provider_instance_size_name
properties.description: • provider_instance_size_name - (Required) Atlas provides different instance sizes, each with a default storage capacity and RAM size. The instance size you select is used for all the data-bearing servers in your cluster. See Create a Cluster providerSettings.instanceSizeName for valid values and default resources.

properties.name: provider_instance_size_name
properties.description: • provider_instance_size_name - (Required) Atlas provides different instance sizes, each with a default storage capacity and RAM size. The instance size you select is used for all the data-bearing servers in your cluster. See Create a Cluster providerSettings.instanceSizeName for valid values and default resources.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: auto_scaling_disk_gb_enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether disk auto-scaling is enabled. The default is true.

properties.name: true
properties.description: • Set to true to enable disk auto-scaling.

properties.name: false
properties.description: • Set to false to disable disk auto-scaling.

properties.name: backup_enabled
properties.description:
• backup_enabled - (Optional) Set to true to enable Atlas continuous backups for the cluster.

    Set to false to disable continuous backups for the cluster. Atlas deletes any stored snapshots. See the continuous backup Snapshot Schedule for more information.

    You cannot enable continuous backups if you have an existing cluster in the project with Cloud Provider Snapshots enabled.

    The default value is false.

properties.name: bi_connector
properties.description: • bi_connector - (Optional) Specifies BI Connector for Atlas configuration on this cluster. BI Connector for Atlas is only available for M10+ clusters. See BI Connector below for more details.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: cluster_type - (Optional) Specifies the type of the cluster that you want to modify. You cannot convert a sharded cluster deployment to a replica set deployment.

properties.name: REPLICASET
properties.description: Replica set

properties.name: SHARDED
properties.description: Sharded cluster

properties.name: GEOSHARDED
properties.description: Global Cluster

properties.name: disk_size_gb
properties.description:
• disk_size_gb - (Optional) The size in gigabytes of the server’s root volume. You can add capacity by increasing this number, up to a maximum possible value of 4096 (i.e., 4 TB). This value must be a positive integer.

    The minimum disk size for dedicated clusters is 10GB for AWS and GCP, and 32GB for Azure. If you specify diskSizeGB with a lower disk size, Atlas defaults to the minimum disk size value.

properties.name: encryption_at_rest_provider
properties.description: • encryption_at_rest_provider - (Optional) Set the Encryption at Rest parameter. Possible values are AWS, GCP, AZURE or NONE. Requires M10 or greater and for backup_enabled to be false or omitted.

properties.name: mongo_db_major_version
properties.description: • mongo_db_major_version - (Optional) Version of the cluster to deploy. Atlas supports the following MongoDB versions for M10+ clusters: 3.4, 3.6 or 4.0. You must set this value to 4.0 if provider_instance_size_name is either M2 or M5.

properties.name: num_shards
properties.description: • num_shards - (Optional) Selects whether the cluster is a replica set or a sharded cluster. If you use the replicationSpecs parameter, you must set num_shards.

properties.name: provider_backup_enabled
properties.description:
• provider_backup_enabled - (Optional) Flag indicating if the cluster uses Cloud Provider Snapshots for backups.

    If true, the cluster uses Cloud Provider Snapshots for backups. If providerBackupEnabled and backupEnabled are false, the cluster does not use Atlas backups.

    You cannot enable cloud provider snapshots if you have an existing cluster in the project with Continuous Backups enabled.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: backing_provider_name - (Optional) Cloud service provider on which the server for a multi-tenant cluster is provisioned. (Note: When upgrading from a multi-tenant cluster to a dedicated cluster remove this argument.)

properties.name: AWS - Amazon AWS
properties.description: • AWS - Amazon AWS

properties.name: GCP - Google Cloud Platform
properties.description: • GCP - Google Cloud Platform

properties.name: AZURE - Microsoft Azure
properties.description: • AZURE - Microsoft Azure

properties.name: provider_disk_iops
properties.description: • provider_disk_iops - (Optional) The maximum input/output operations per second (IOPS) the system can perform. The possible values depend on the selected providerSettings.instanceSizeName and diskSizeGB.

properties.name: provider_disk_type_name
properties.description: • provider_disk_type_name - (Optional) Azure disk type of the server’s root volume. If omitted, Atlas uses the default disk type for the selected providerSettings.instanceSizeName.

properties.name: provider_encrypt_ebs_volume
properties.description: • provider_encrypt_ebs_volume - (Optional) If enabled, the Amazon EBS encryption feature encrypts the server’s root volume for both data at rest within the volume and for data moving between the volume and the instance.

properties.name: provider_region_name
properties.description: • provider_region_name - (Optional) Physical location of your MongoDB cluster. The region you choose can affect network latency for clients accessing your databases. Requires the Atlas Region name, see the reference list for AWS, GCP, Azure. Do not specify this field when creating a multi-region cluster using the replicationSpec document or a Global Cluster with the replicationSpecs array.

properties.name: provider_volume_type
properties.description: • provider_volume_type - (AWS - Optional) The type of the volume. The possible values are: STANDARD and PROVISIONED. PROVISIONED required if setting IOPS higher than the default instance IOPS.

properties.name: replication_factor
properties.description: • replication_factor - (Optional) Number of replica set members. Each member keeps a copy of your databases, providing high availability and data redundancy. The possible values are 3, 5, or 7. The default value is 3.

properties.name: replication_specs
properties.description: • replication_specs - (Optional) Configuration for cluster regions. See Replication Spec below for more details.

properties.name: bi-connector
properties.description: » BI Connector
Specifies BI Connector for Atlas configuration.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: enabled - (Optional) Specifies whether or not BI Connector for Atlas is enabled on the cluster.

properties.name: true
properties.description: • Set to true to enable BI Connector for Atlas.

properties.name: false
properties.description: • Set to false to disable BI Connector for Atlas.

properties.name: list description
properties.description: read_preference - (Optional) Specifies the read preference to be used by BI Connector for Atlas on the cluster. Each BI Connector for Atlas read preference contains a distinct combination of readPreference and readPreferenceTags options. For details on BI Connector for Atlas read preferences, refer to the BI Connector Read Preferences Table.

properties.name: Set to "primary" to have BI Connector for Atlas read from the primary.
properties.description: • Set to "primary" to have BI Connector for Atlas read from the primary.

properties.name: Set to "secondary" to have BI Connector for Atlas read from a secondary member. Default if there are no analytics nodes in the cluster.
properties.description: • Set to "secondary" to have BI Connector for Atlas read from a secondary member. Default if there are no analytics nodes in the cluster.

properties.name: Set to "analytics" to have BI Connector for Atlas read from an analytics node. Default if the cluster contains analytics nodes.
properties.description: • Set to "analytics" to have BI Connector for Atlas read from an analytics node. Default if the cluster contains analytics nodes.

properties.name: replication-spec
properties.description: » Replication Spec
Configuration for cluster regions.

properties.name: num_shards
properties.description: (Required) Number of shards to deploy in the specified zone.

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Optional) Unique identifer of the replication document for a zone in a Global Cluster.

properties.name: regions_config
properties.description: (Optional) Physical location of the region. Each regionsConfig document describes the region’s priority in elections and the number and type of MongoDB nodes Atlas deploys to the region. You must order each regionsConfigs document by regionsConfig.priority, descending. See Region Config below for more details.

properties.name: zone_name
properties.description: (Optional) Name for the zone in a Global Cluster.

properties.name: region-config
properties.description: » Region Config
Physical location of the region.

properties.name: region_name
properties.description: (Optional) Name for the region specified.

properties.name: electable_nodes
properties.description: (Optional) Number of electable nodes for Atlas to deploy to the region. Electable nodes can become the primary and can facilitate local reads.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: (Optional) Election priority of the region. For regions with only read-only nodes, set this value to 0.

properties.name: read_only_nodes
properties.description: (Optional) Number of read-only nodes for Atlas to deploy to the region. Read-only nodes can never become the primary, but can facilitate local-reads. Specify 0 if you do not want any read-only nodes in the region.

properties.name: analytics_nodes
properties.description:
• analytics_nodes - (Optional) The number of analytics nodes for Atlas to deploy to the region. Analytics nodes are useful for handling analytic data such as reporting queries from BI Connector for Atlas. Analytics nodes are read-only, and can never become the primary.

    If you do not specify this option, no analytics nodes are deployed to the region.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The unique ID for the project to create the database user.

properties.name: atlas_cidr_block
properties.description: (Required) CIDR block that Atlas uses for your clusters. Atlas uses the specified CIDR block for all other Network Peering connections created in the project. The Atlas CIDR block must be at least a /24 and at most a /21 in one of the following private networks.

properties.name: provider_name
properties.description: - (Optional) Cloud provider for this Network Peering connection. If omitted, Atlas sets this parameter to AWS.

properties.name: region_name
properties.description: (Optional | AWS provider only) AWS region.

properties.name: region
properties.description: (Optional | AZURE provider only) Azure region where the container resides.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the project you want to create.

properties.name: org_id
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the organization you want to create the project within.
NOTE: Project created by API Keys must belong to an existing organization.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the project for the Atlas cluster.

properties.name: cluster_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Atlas cluster that contains the snapshots you want to retrieve.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Required) Description of the on-demand snapshot.

properties.name: retention_in_days
properties.description: (Required) The number of days that Atlas should retain the on-demand snapshot. Must be at least 1.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The unique identifier of the project for the Atlas cluster whose snapshot you want to restore.

properties.name: cluster_name
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Atlas cluster whose snapshot you want to restore.

properties.name: snapshot_id
properties.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the snapshot to restore.

properties.name: delivery_type
properties.description: (Required) Type of restore job to create. Possible values are: download or automated, only one must be set it in true.

properties.name: download
properties.description: » Download
Atlas provides a URL to download a .tar.gz of the snapshot with snapshotId.

properties.name: automated
properties.description: » Automated

Atlas automatically restores the snapshot with snapshotId to the Atlas cluster with name targetClusterName in the Atlas project with targetGroupId. if you want to use automated delivery type, you must to set the following arguments:

properties.name: target_cluster_name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the target Atlas cluster to which the restore job restores the snapshot. Only required if deliveryType is automated.

properties.name: target_group_id
properties.description: (Required) Unique ID of the target Atlas project for the specified targetClusterName. Only required if deliveryType is automated.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The unique identifier for the project.

properties.name: aws_kms
properties.description: (Required) Specifies AWS KMS configuration details and whether Encryption at Rest is enabled for an Atlas project.

properties.name: azure_key_vault
properties.description: (Required) Specifies Azure Key Vault configuration details and whether Encryption at Rest is enabled for an Atlas project.

properties.name: google_cloud_kms
properties.description: (Required) Specifies GCP KMS configuration details and whether Encryption at Rest is enabled for an Atlas project.

properties.name: aws_kms-1
properties.description: » aws_kms

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Specifies whether Encryption at Rest is enabled for an Atlas project, To disable Encryption at Rest, pass only this parameter with a value of false, When you disable Encryption at Rest, Atlas also removes the configuration details.

properties.name: access_key_id
properties.description: The IAM access key ID with permissions to access the customer master key specified by customerMasterKeyID.

properties.name: secret_access_key
properties.description: The IAM secret access key with permissions to access the customer master key specified by customerMasterKeyID.

properties.name: customer_master_key_id
properties.description: The AWS customer master key used to encrypt and decrypt the MongoDB master keys.

properties.name: region
properties.description: The AWS region in which the AWS customer master key exists: CA_CENTRAL_1, US_EAST_1, US_EAST_2, US_WEST_1, US_WEST_2, SA_EAST_1

properties.name: azure_key_vault-1
properties.description: » azure_key_vault

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Specifies whether Encryption at Rest is enabled for an Atlas project. To disable Encryption at Rest, pass only this parameter with a value of false. When you disable Encryption at Rest, Atlas also removes the configuration details.

properties.name: client_id
properties.description: The client ID, also known as the application ID, for an Azure application associated with the Azure AD tenant.

properties.name: azure_environment
properties.description: The Azure environment where the Azure account credentials reside. Valid values are the following: AZURE, AZURE_CHINA, AZURE_GERMANY

properties.name: subscription_id
properties.description: The unique identifier associated with an Azure subscription.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: The name of the Azure Resource group that contains an Azure Key Vault.

properties.name: key_vault_name
properties.description: The name of an Azure Key Vault containing your key.

properties.name: key_identifier
properties.description: The unique identifier of a key in an Azure Key Vault.

properties.name: secret
properties.description: The secret associated with the Azure Key Vault specified by azureKeyVault.tenantID.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: The unique identifier for an Azure AD tenant within an Azure subscription.

properties.name: google_cloud_kms-1
properties.description: » google_cloud_kms

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Specifies whether Encryption at Rest is enabled for an Atlas project. To disable Encryption at Rest, pass only this parameter with a value of false. When you disable Encryption at Rest, Atlas also removes the configuration details.

properties.name: service_account_key
properties.description: String-formatted JSON object containing GCP KMS credentials from your GCP account.

properties.name: key_version_resource_id
properties.description: The Key Version Resource ID from your GCP account.
For more information see: MongoDB Atlas API Reference.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The unique ID for the project to create the database user.

properties.name: container_id
properties.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the Atlas VPC container for the region. You can create an Atlas VPC container using the Create Container endpoint. You cannot create more than one container per region. To retrieve a list of container IDs, use the Get list of VPC containers endpoint.

properties.name: accepter_region_name
properties.description: (Optional | AWS Required) Specifies the region where the peer VPC resides. For complete lists of supported regions, see Amazon Web Services.

properties.name: aws_account_id
properties.description: (Optional | AWS Required) Account ID of the owner of the peer VPC.

properties.name: provider_name
properties.description: (Optional) Cloud provider for this VPC peering connection. If omitted, Atlas sets this parameter to AWS. (Possible Values AWS, AZURE, GCP).

properties.name: route_table_cidr_block
properties.description: (Optional | AWS Required) Peer VPC CIDR block or subnet.

properties.name: vpc_id
properties.description: (Optional | AWS Required) Unique identifier of the peer VPC.

properties.name: atlas_cidr_block
properties.description: (Optional | AZURE Required) Unique identifier for an Azure AD directory.

properties.name: azure_directory_id
properties.description: (Optional | AZURE Required) Unique identifier for an Azure AD directory.

properties.name: azure_subscription_id
properties.description: (Optional | AZURE Required) Unique identifer of the Azure subscription in which the VNet resides.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: (Optional | AZURE Required) Name of your Azure resource group.

properties.name: vnet_name
properties.description: (Optional | AZURE Required) Name of your Azure VNet.

properties.name: gcp_project_id
properties.description: (Optinal | GCP Required) GCP project ID of the owner of the network peer.

properties.name: network_name
properties.description: (Optional | GCP Required) Name of the network peer to which Atlas connects.

properties.name: project_id
properties.description: (Required) The unique ID for the project to enable Only Private IP Mode.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Indicates whether Connect via Peering Only mode is enabled or disabled for an Atlas project.
